comment: I took Kersey online for history. He gave small amounts of work, and the lectures were thorough. The textbook is provided and went along with the lectures. The quizzes were lightwork and crosswords were light work. The only hard things were the tests that have essay portions and is lock down. He's very understanding as long as you communicate.
rating_tags: Caring--Test heavy

comment: Please look up "Terry Kersey" on here and read those reviews as well. Huge mistake picking him for this required class to graduate. Hates teaching. Enjoys making a required class harder for students to do well in. Will dock points on the essay and tell you to write what you put in the paper word for word.
rating_tags: Get ready to read

comment: The class itself is easy and the professor provides lectures and PowerPoints so it's easy to follow. There is a quiz and crossword puzzle each week that are extremely easy. There are also only four tests along with two essay for the semester. My only complaint would be that there are no study guides for the tests he gives.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback--Graded by few things

comment: He is not very understanding. He is okay, but I'd take this class again if this were a last resort. He doesn't seem like he ever wants to be bothered when I email him. This is kind of confusing with his lectures on d2l because he seems outgoing. The tests were random; I never knew what I was studying for with him having no study guide for the class
rating_tags: Test heavy--Online Savvy

comment: Overall, I would say he is okay. He doesn't provide study guides, so you're on your own. If you don't get at least a B on all of the exams, you might have a C in the class. The way he grades is terrible; you have to have a total of 900 points to have an A. So that means you have to do every assignment. which isn't the issue; the tests matter!!!!
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: Took his online 2111, was the easiest and least time consuming class I've taken in years. He wanted one crossword and one quiz taken a week that took less than 15 mins total. Great class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback

comment: The weekly homework is very easy, but the tests are harder and on a lockdown browser. There are also two essays, but they are not very hard at all.
rating_tags: Test heavy

comment: Professor Kersey is a likable person, however I have never had a less enjoyable professor/teacher to work with in my entire scholastic career. When I would email him asking questions he would condescendingly mention that I'm the only one asking about said issue, and go on to essentially say "that's tough".  Avoid at all costs!

Weekly crossword and quiz assignments based on the textbook. Lecture slides aren't related to the test, he just uses them as framework for his lectures. Four tests (multiple choice and short answer) and two essays. Lockdown browser with webcam mandatory. Read the first two sentences of each paragraph in the textbook - that's what the tests are on.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: This class wasn't hard by any means. I mostly looked over the PowerPoints and would watch some of the videos. His grading standards are clear in the syllabus. Just put in the work and you will be fine. There are four test, two essays, short quizzes, and finally crossword puzzles. It sounds like a a lot but it's really easy.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Lecture heavy

comment: Not the best teacher for this course. I wouldn't say he's awful, but he purposefully does not provide his students with study guides for his tests, which makes them somewhat difficult. There are weekly crosswords, 4 tests (proctored), easy quizzes (not proctored), and weekly discussion posts that are not graded. Not the best teacher, be prepared.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: He is decent overall, but he does expect you to watch his lecture videos. Weekly crosswords, easy quizzes, and discussions that he doesnt check. There are four tests with lockdown browser (20 multi choice, 4 short answer) and two essays that make up most of your grade. The test questions are kinda weird and dont have quizlets. Easy essay grader.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: Not a bad course, lots of reading each week! Grade is carried by quizzes/crosswords that you have multiple attempts on. Tests are difficult but not impossible, uses lockdown browser and some questions are written responses. This class isn't just memorization, you actually have to put the effort to learn material and apply it on the tests.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: I took this history class online I recommend to take a history class online . Weekly crossword puzzles ( very easy ) and a 5 question review quizzes ( you have 10 attempts on them ) . ESSAYS were easy but dont slack on them , put in effort you get a good grade . Exams are a little hard I would say to just study the chapters he gives . Easy class
rating_tags: Online Savvy--Get ready to read

comment:
Dr. Kersey is a nice guy and his lectures cover material relevant to the tests. However, the lectures are long and hard to follow along. Moreover, he doesn't provide any type of study guide for the tests. 

He should really simplify his presentations and give some sort of study guide to help students prepare for the tests.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: I wasn't able to pay attention to his lectures because they were boring and uninspiring--which meant I had to spend extra time reading the textbook days before the (proctored) test trying to memorize everything. He did help us out by carrying our grade with the participation grade and weekly crossword assignments, though.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: This class really was just okay. It wasnt too hard because I read the textbook and did the few assignments (crossword puzzles and discussion boards). Lectures and readings were just boring. However, the professor really makes sure you know how to get an A in the class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: One of the best professors I've had. Easy A, a class you have to purposefully try to fail. Weekly crosswords and lecture quizzes can be ctrl f'ed or easily found in the textbook he provides for free. His powerpoints actually have important information and his lecture style can be interesting. Generally a standup guy.
rating_tags: Respected--Hilarious--Caring

comment: He's a nice guy but in all honestly, he's very lecture heavy and doesn't really talk about material on tests. Tip to all incoming freshmen, do not take his class unless you like to read the book a lot and take an online test.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: Here is the class: 3 essay based tests, and discussion questions that are posted every week. That's it. He does take attendance, so show up for at least most of the lectures. His lectures can be boring, but he does have a sense of humor and my section cracks jokes a lot. The tests are 5 out of 10 essays he gives you a week before.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: 3 tests worth 25% of your grade each, they're 5 short essay questions but he gives you 10 possible ??'s a week before. Prepare an essay for each and remember the key points and you'll do fine. The lectures can be dry, but he puts the powerpoints and textbook online. Attendance is worth 10%. Only other work is to ask 1 discussion ?? per week online.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: The lectures are dry and there's no way around that. The tests are online and you write a 5 page paper towards the end of the semester which he grades pretty leniently. He is also a pretty nice guy overall
rating_tags: Get ready to read

comment: Just don't take this class, all he does is lectures every day, It is always the same thing and his tests don't really go along with his lectures you will have to do some very heavy studying.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: If you don't want a heavy work load I would consider taking him. Basically, he gives lectures that put me sleep but its whatever because the power points are online. You have to write two papers but he grades them fairly easily. Also attendance counts for the same amount as the test so if you come to every class you get a 100 for a test grade.
rating_tags: TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I love history especially the cultural aspect of it. He didn't touch on one single cultural aspects its strictly economic stuff so i found it super boring.  His tests are hard, his papers are long, attendance is required, he reads off a powerpoint, and the readings are important. Prob the most boring class I've ever taken.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: He did not communicate well with the class, all of class was him going off topic with nothing to do with the class. You can still pass the class without showing up, but attendance is 10% of your grade. (Showing up to class is awful)
rating_tags: Tough Grader--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: This class is an easy A if you pay attention in class, sit in the front, and take a few notes. He is a little soft spoken, and he does give his personal opinion over some topics but he isn't that bad. A big part of your grade are two essays that count for 25% of your grade each and are graded fairly easily. Test are timed, online so review.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Do not take this professor!!! Classes are incredibly boring and he is an annoying lecturer. Tests and papers are not easy. Seriously, avoid this guy!!!

He gives decent lectures, but he barely gives enough time for the online tests and many of the questions are confusing. There is no textbook, only assigned articles. He talks very quietly so you need to sit near the front to hear. Two papers are assigned and he is strict with the grammar and structure, which are not his strong suits either. Avoid!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Attendance counts towards your grade. Lectures are long and he's a soft spoken guy so he can be difficult to hear sometimes; definitely recommend sitting in the front of the room for this one. Tests are all on D2L, but questions are somewhat difficult to interpret. No textbook required. Decent professor, but not necessarily easy.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: He's nice and wants you to pass. You actually have to read the textbook if you want an A.

I recommend getting the e-book and make sure you attend all classes. It is 10% of your grade. You have essays to write at 1000 words each. 4 Test online. Just show up and write in an okay essay format.

I really enjoyed taking his class! He is funny but still knows the topics very well. Attendance is mandatory and you sign in every class. He is a pretty easy grader on the 4 essays you have to write so just write 1000 words and you should get a fair grade.

I recommend this professor if you don't mind typing papers and taking the tests online, which are easy. His lectures go on and on about pointless information that isn't on the test. Papers are pointless but easy.

Professor Kersey knows his stuff and seems like a very nice person, but personally, I had a hard time following his teaching style. Very boring lectures. 4 tests and 4 essays. Tests are online, and 85% of the questions are on quizlet, but hurry because the tests are timed; you'll probably finish with a minute to spare. Minimal effort B.

Hard to fail. Go to class, listen and you'll pass. He makes history interesting for you unlike most. You have one paper, about 4 tests, weekly homework, which is easy, and attendance counts as a grade as well.

Professor Kersey is very vocal about his political beliefs so keep an open mind. Everything you need to know to pass the class is in the syllabus and on D2L. Attendance matters. There are 10 weekly assignments and a paper on historical documents and they're easy enough. The tests are tough. Do the reading. Don't just count on notes.
Great professor. Knows his stuff. Grading is straight forward and not dependent on test only. Funny guy. Easy going.

He is the worse professor I have ever taken! I'm very good at history and he makes me hate the subject and very difficult. He does not excuse anything. He does not give enought time for exams either! Do not take him at all! Worse teacher in KSU. Even complained to the department.

The professor is really knowledgeable and his lectures does contributes to the exams. It is wise to listen. I appreciate the weekly reports,summaries, that expands my knowledge on significant historical events that shaped America. It is an easy, reading and comprehension class. There are no group projects, no dates to remember nor essays to write.

Worst history class I've ever taken. He isn't clear about anything, he just rambles for the ENTIRE class. You will never get out early, even if we've covered everything. Attendence is mandatory. His tests are near impossible. He takes it way too seriously for a basic history class. Avoid him at all costs.

I honestly have no idea where KSU finds its staff. If there was a more incompetent instructor in the entire social services building, I do not want to know about them. He put the exams on D2L with no understanding of D2L itself. Several times the exam would have flaws and misspellings and would even count a right answer wrong. AVOID.

Attendance is mandatory but his lectures are soooooo boring. He is never clear about what is on the test at all. He just expects you to remember very concept from the lectures and gives you no study guide. It was supposed to be a basic history class that ended up being impossible. Do NOT take this, it's way too much effort for a basic class.

Great professor. Lectures are pretty dry, but his insights are interesting. The final and midterm are worth both 40% of your grade (80% total). Attendance is mandatory, 10% of your grade, and weekly insights on articles are the last 10%. Gives you ten questions for final and midterm 1 week prior, and picks 5 of the exact questions for exam.

I absolutely love history, however Professor Kersey made me dislike his class. His lectures were very very dry, and I did not appreciate his need to add his personal political views to each lecture. Attendance is mandatory cause he knows if we had a choice, we wouldn't attend class to hear him on his soapbox.

Great professor. No tests or quizzes, just midterm and final, both of which consist of 5 essay questions. He gives you a list of 10 the week before and picks 5 from the list. Lectures can be a bit dry sometimes but he tries to make it interesting.
He's very laid back. No tests, just a midterm and a final. He doesn't make you remember dates, events are the key. Be sure to do the primary document every week.

you have to buy 2 books. One for article reviews he makes you do and the other for the chapters you must know. He only has a midterm and a final. He gives you 10 essay questions a couple days before the exam and he tells you he will pick 5 of them for the exam. Study all! you will do fine. Look up answers in the book. Go to class! Got an easy A.
